title: Ticket #3714: condor_status -t works only if -t is last command-line flag
description:
Here is another very minor issue with condor_status under 8.0 (though it could have been this way in 7.6 as well). In particular, the "-t" option works if and only if it is the last command line argument, though spelling out as "-total" works independent of position, e.g.,

[root@ldas-grid ~]# condor_status -t Total Owner Claimed Unclaimed Matched Preempting Backfill 

        X86_64/LINUX  2891     0    2831        60       0          0
0


               Total  2891     0    2831        60       0          0
0
[root@ldas-grid ~]# condor_status -t -pool condor
[root@ldas-grid ~]# condor_status -total -pool condor
                     Total Owner Claimed Unclaimed Matched Preempting
Backfill


        X86_64/LINUX  2891     0    2839        52       0          0
0


               Total  2891     0    2839        52       0          0
0
[root@ldas-grid ~]# condor_status -pool condor -t
                     Total Owner Claimed Unclaimed Matched Preempting
Backfill


        X86_64/LINUX  2890     0    2854        36       0          0
0


               Total  2890     0    2854        36       0          0
0
